Name: Scratchees: Boomtown Baseball
Description:
5 Different Boomtown Baseball Games

Free! Dr. Scratchov Scratcher!

disposable games to scratch, play & throw away

OBJECTIVE:  The Boomtown "Bats" are hosting their archrivals, The Mudville "Muggers", in another classic confrontation at famous Boomtown Stadium!  It's the top of the ninth,  Neither team has scored.  Who will win this critical game?

PREPARATION:  Choose your team.  The teams bat with a lineup of four batters picked at random from their full team of nine.  A batter's lifetime "stats" are shown below his name.  The batting order starts at the top (near the pitch indicators) and is repeated if necessary by returning to #1 as the fifth batter.  Keep track of all base runner with pennies placed on the baseball diamond.  The "Muggers" bat first.

HOW TO PLAY:  The pitcher throws each ball by placing his finger tip on the pitch of his choice and announcing either "fast ball", "curve ball", or "slider".  The other player then scratches any one of his four "swing" boxes" under the pitch for the player he has at bat (if all a batter's swing boxes are scratched for one type of pitch, the pitcher must throw something else). It will reveal one of the following results:

HR (Home Run)  - It's a hit out of the park.  The batter and all runners score.

X (Strike) - Get 3 strikes and the batter is out.

W (Walk) - The batter advances to first base.

G (Grounder) - It's a hit.  The pitching team must play the ball.  The pitcher scratches any one of his ten "Infield" squares to see the results of the play.

FB (Fly Ball) - It's a  hit.  The pitching team must play the ball.  The pitcher scratches any one his ten "Outfield" squares to see the results of the play.

When and Grounder or Fly Ball is played by the pitcher the following things can result:
S (Single) - The batter and all runners advance one base.
D (Double) - The batter and all runners advance two bases.
T (Triple) - The batter and all runners advance three bases.
HR (Home Run) - The batter and all runners score.
O (Out) - The batter is out.
DP (Double Play) - The batter and the furthest advanced runner (if there is one) are out.  Scratch two out squares on the scoreboard.

Keep track of "Runs" and "Outs" by scratching the squares left to right on the score board.  After the "Muggers" have made three outs, the roles reverse and the "Bats" come up to the plate.  After the "Bats" have three outs, the game is over.  The team with the highest score wins.  In the event of a tie, play another card for "extra innings".

SPECIAL HINT:  You will notice, after playing a few games, that each of the nine batters on each team always bats exactly the same way every time.  For example, Homer Bundy, the slugger Right Fielder for the "Muggers", always hits a home run if you pitch him a fast ball.  The more you know about each batter, the better you can pick the right pitch or choose the right swing.  Fast ball pitches tent to either be hit hard or get a strike.  Sliders tend to produce grounders, and curve balls tend to produce a lot of fly balls and walks.

—user summary

Name: Scratchees: Geekzilla
Description:
You were just a normal pencil-neck geek working on your computer when suddenly, it filled the room with weird radiation and turned you into a 150-foot tall monster - GEEKZILLA!  You go on a rampage downtown and collect everything you find!

Decide who goes first.  Take turns scratching any window on the sky-scrapers to see what you find inside.  You score points depending on what interesting things are found in the window.  Keep track of your points in your head or by writing on the scoring building.

After all windows have been broken into, the player who has scored the most points wins the game!  You will see:

GIRL IN TOWEL - 50 points.  She screams at you!

COMPUTER - 25 points.  A geekzilla's best friend!

DOG - 10 points.  A geekzilla's second best friend!

VIDEO GAMES - 5 points.  (Clue: a computer is in one of the nearby windows!)

SECURITY GUARD - 0 points.  For some reason, they shoot at you if you try to grab them.  Leave them alone.

BROKEN GLASSES - Oh no!  Your opponent takes 2 turns in a row while you fix your glasses.

—user summary

Name: Scratchees: Dinosaur Disaster!
Description:
You are scientists who have just discovered the greatest dinosaur burial grounds ever found!  Million of years ago. a comet hit this spot and buried hundreds of dinosaurs.  Unfortunately, the comet also sprayed radioactive uranium all around, so be careful where you dig!

The fist player to dig up 21 points worth of bones is the best dinosaur digger and wins the game.

Decide who goes first.  Take turns digging in the dinosaur pit by scratching any circle.  You see:

VERTEBRA BONE - 1 point.  Mark your score at the top.

LEG BONE - 2 points.

SKULL BONE - 3 points.

URANIUM! - Oh no!  You must be decontaminated before you can resume digging.  Scratch any oval on the decontamination shack.  If it says "Yes", you are safe and can continue digging on your next turn.,  But if says "No", you must stay in the shack and try again next turn.

FIDO - Whoops!  Score 1 point for your opponent!  You found a bone but Fido, the camp's mascot dog, took it from you and gave it to the opponent!

—user summary

Name: Scratchees: Mutant Parents From Planet Mars
Description:
Friendly parents on Mars are trying to escape to freedom on Earth, but the evil Martian politicians are turning them into mutants!  You have just arrived in your rescue ships and are battling to save the parents.  After all spaces are scratched, the player who has rescued the most pairs of Moms and Dads is the winner!

Decide who goes first.  Take turns.  Each turn scratch any 2 spaces on the planet.  There are 4 different things you can find: A MOM, DAD, MARTIAN OR EXPLOSION.  Match both spaces you scratched to see what happens:

Mom + DAD - Perfect match!  Score one of each on your rescue ship and take another turn!

MOM + MOM - Score 2 Moms.  You saved them!

DAD + DAD - Score 2 Dads.  You saved them!

Martian + Mom or Dad - Oh no!  Your opponent scores the Mom or Dad while you fight the Martian Off!

DOUBLE MARTIANS - Your opponent gets to take 2 turns in a row while you fight the Martians off!

EXPLOSION + ANYTHING - An explosion destroys whatever else you scratched.  No points scored!

DOUBLE EXPLOSION - Awesome!  Martians watch the fireworks while you take another turn!

—user summary

Name: Scratchees: Suck Up The Slugs!
Description:
Scientists have just discovered that Amazon slug juice can give you superhuman powers!  Healthy Amazon slugs are now selling for thousands of dollars each!  You and your partner buy slug-sucking machines and head south to the Amazon to suck up as many slugs as you can sell!  The first sucker to suck up 16 slugs wins the game! 
 Decide who goes first.  Take turns scratching in the forest.  You see:

LEAF - Good!  Slugs hide under leaves.  Scratch any space on the leaf pile to see if you find 1, 2 or 3 slugs.  Scratch this many spaces on your slug sack to mark your score.

SLUG SLIME - Clue: there must be some slugs near this space because slugs leave a slime trail when they move.

SNAIL - Your opponent takes 2 turns in a row because your sucked a snail by mistake and it clogged your slug-sucker.

SQUISH - Yuck!  You stepped on a slug!  No score this turn.

GIANT AMAZON MOTHER SLUG - Oh no!  She doesn't like you sucking up her slugs so she attacks you!  Luckily, you brought salt to defend yourself.  Throw a box of salt on your Giant Slug at the top of the card by scratching one of the 4 "salt boxes".  You only have 4 boxes, so if you get attacked a 5th time, a Mother Slug smothers and slimes you and you lose the game!

—user summary

Name: Mein Kirschbaum
Description:
Each player gets a tree in a garden and a bucket. First each player hangs 10 cherries in his/her tree. At the players turn he/she turns the arrow on the disk and acts according the field where the arrow stops. Either picking 1 – 4 cherries if it lands on the cherry fields, or if it lands on a field with a bird or a dog you loose 2 cherries and have to hang them back on the tree. If it lands on the field with the tipped basket you have tho hang all the cherries back on the tree. Winner is who collects first 10 cherries of his/her tree.

Jeder Spieler bekommt einen Baum in einem Garten und einen Eimer. Zuerst hängt jeder Spieler 10 Kirschen in seinen Baum. Beim Drehen des aktuellen Spielers dreht er/sie den Pfeil auf der Scheibe und handelt entsprechend dem Feld, in dem der Pfeil landet. Entweder pflücken man 1-4 Kirschen, wenn es auf den Kirschfeldern landet, oder wenn es auf einem Feld mit einem Vogel oder einem Hund landet, verlieret man 2 Kirschen und man muss sie wieder an den Baum hängen. Wenn es auf dem Feld mit dem gekippten Korb landet, müssen Sie alle Kirschen wieder an den Baum gehängt werden. Gewinner ist, wer als erster die 10 Kirschen seines Baumes sammelt.

Name: Time of Legends: Joan of Arc – Teutonic Knights
Description:
Eastern Europe is no less steeped in bloody battle and mystical intrigue than Joan’s native France. With this in mind, we thought that the Teutonic Knights and their foes would be an excellent addition to the Time of Legends: Joan of Arc game. As with the core game, we haven’t stopped at the historical events though: we’ve also delved into the pagan past of the Lithuanians and Poles to find some worthy adversaries for the evangelising crusades of the Teutonic Knights.

Teutonic Knights expands the game in 3 main areas: new characters and armies, new battlefields, and new scenarios.

—description from the publisher
Families: Game: Time of Legends – Joan of Arc

Name: Dog Boats: Battle of the Narrow Seas
Description:
Dog Boats: Battle of the Narrow Seas is a tactical-level wargame where you (as the Captain) take the command of either a Royal Navy Fairmile D motor gunboat (MGB) squadron or Vosper 72' motor torpedo boat (MTB) squadron in either the English Channel or North Sea from 1943-1944. Your main goal is to survive the war while sinking as many enemy ships as you and your squadron can.

Enemies you and your crewmen will face include a variety of enemy ships, including E-boats, R-Boats, and patrol aircraft. Weather conditions and sea state are also modeled.

The player will move his squadron through various travel boxes on a map of the English Channel or North Sea during each mission on his way to the patrol area, then must successfully return back to home base.

Game components include a crewmen placement mats, strategic map mat, several Tables books, crewmen status sheets, campaign log sheet, and counter sheets representing individual MGBs, MTBs, enemy aircraft, warships, etc.

—description from the designer

Name: Jigūan: The Eastern Mechanist – 2019 Essen Promo Cards
Description:
This Promo Cards offer four new ability that can replace the original ability.

Replace your Workshop ability with this new ability.

- Once per turn, you may pay 3 of the same Gears to advance your level by 1 on a Pagoda or gain 5 Points.
- Anytime during your turn, you can +1 or-1 to the value of your Blueprints. Every time you get a new Blueprint, gain 1 Point.
- At the end of the game, if you have one of each of the 5 Mechanical Beasts, gain 15 Points. If you have 2 sets, get 30 Points.
- Every time you perform Action [A] Get Gears, you gain 1 Coin. Anytime during your turn, you may pay 1 Coin to gain 1 Energy (Unlimited times).

Name: Spinning Maze
Description:
A highly fascinating game which develops ingenuity and foresight.

Beware of the spinning traps of maze and your opponents.

A constantly changing game due to the spinning mechanism which provides unlimited challenge and joy.

Object of the game is to enter the Escape Zone (the center of the Maze) with all your pawns before the other player(s).
This is not as easy as it seems! The maze walls (red lines) are impossible to pass and as they are rotating you can get trapped. Can you beat your opponents, who try to block you, and be the winner?


Each player gets pawns of the same color according to the number of players:
4 players: 4 pawns each 
3 players: 5 pawns each 
2 players: 6 pawns each 
The player who plays first is picked randomly. The order of other players is defined in a clockwise manner. 
Initially, the pawns of each player are placed at the first (Entrance - outer) zone of the maze.

Each turn is comprised of two steps:
Step 1: The first player moves his/her pawns and then rotates the walls clockwise (by 15o)  
Step 2: The rest of the players do the same.

The pawns can move only in one direction, either Radially or Peripherally, for as many fields as you wish until they are blocked by the walls of the maze or by an opponent’s pawn. The walls (red lines) of the Maze are the natural boundaries of the Maze and you cannot overpass them with your pawns. You cannot overpass your opponent(s)’ pawns either.

Anytime that a pawn is blocked in every direction either by the maze walls and/or by opponent(s) pawn(s), you have to immediately remove that pawn from the current turn of game and pick it out of the board. Next time you play, place that pawn in a field of your choice back into the Entrance Zone and do not move it any further. You can move your pawn normally when your turn to play comes again.

The player who manages to reach the Escape Zone with all of his pawns first wins the game.

—description from the publisher

Name: War by Sail
Description:
War by Sail is a simple yet comprehensive age of sail wargame, aimed at small fleet actions of 3 to 30 ships per side, with a focus on historical accuracy and flavor.

Researched and playtested for 10 months, War by Sail includes detailed ship rosters for 20 different conflicts, spanning from 1563 to 1812. Generic units are also provided for the 1300 - 1550 period.

A Generic ship list is given for each period (such as "Third Rate", "Fourth Rate" etc.), as well as individual named ships (over 1,700 in total!), showing each ship's weaponry, size, maneuverability and suchlike. Get ready to learn how many Demi-Cannons and Culverins your favorite 17th century English ship had...

War by Sail emphasizes crew quality and morale, as well as real tactics of the periods, and carefully reflects changes in naval technology throughout the centuries.

Conflicts Covered:

Generic Ships – 1300 – 1550
Northern Seven Years' War – 1563 - 1570
Battle of Lepanto – 1571
Spanish Armada – 1588
First Anglo-Dutch War – 1652 - 1654
Second Anglo-Dutch War –  1665 – 1667
Third Anglo-Dutch War – 1672 - 1674
Second Northern War – 1655 - 1660
Scanian War – 1675 - 1679
Nine Years' War – 1688 - 1697
Great Northern War – 1700 - 1721
War of the Spanish Succession – 1701 - 1714
War of the Austrian Succession – 1740 - 1748
Seven Years' War – 1756 - 1763
American War of Independence – 1775 - 1783
Russo-Turkish War – 1787 - 1792
Russo-Swedish War – 1788 - 1790
French Revolutionary Wars – 1792 - 1802
Napoleonic Wars – 1803 - 1815
War of 1812 – 1812 - 1815
A game of War by Sail can last anywhere from an hour and a half to 2 or 3 hours, depending on the size of the battle. At the start of the turn all ships make a mandatory forward move based on their direction relative to the wind (SPILL SAIL! WE'RE ABOUT TO COLLIDE), after which individual ships activate, making turns, and attacks (providing their crew is on the ball enough...). Crew quality determines if a ship is able to activate and also the speed at which they reload.

—description from the designer
Families: History: War of the Austrian Succession
History: War of the Spanish Succession

Name: Co-op
Description:
Co-op is part simulation, part send-up, of the unique experience that is living in a housing cooperative ("co-op" for short). For the unacquainted, living in a co-op is similar to sharing a house with roommates, but with a lot more structure... Members of a co-op typically share responsibilities such as cooking and cleaning, while house rules are established during meetings through direct democracy. Resources, such as food (esp. granola) and utilities, are usually purchased by and shared amongst the members. CO-OP was developed by two seasoned (with sriracha) members of a real housing cooperative, as an attempt to game-ify the fun and complexity of collective living.

In the game, each player represents a housemate in the same co-op. Players must take 1 "action" on each of their turns, the most basic of which are Cleaning and Slacking Off. When a player Slacks Off, they convert some of the house's Cleanliness into their own Free Time (duh!)---this Free Time can be spent to gain points that help win the game. When a player Cleans, they gain access to Karma (by their good deeds), or may influence the very mechanics of the game by trying to pass a House Rule. Karma and Rules are represented by their own decks of cards: the Karma Cards confer secret advantages that may be played at a later opportune moment, while Rules are drafted from a row of 5 cards that are publicly displayed to all players.

It's worth noting that CO-OP is NOT a "cooperative game" (there are individual winners), and there can be a lot to keep track of if you want to best the other players (grrr). However, the play experience is usually quite casual---this is largely due to the Karma Cards, which each have their own co-op-y theme, and require the player to perform a mini-activity in order to gain the card's benefits. Some activities simply encourage players to share their life experience, while others might ask them to sing a song or tell a joke... something different every time!  CO-OP is a blast with friends and family, and also a great way to break the ice with perfect strangers.

—description from the publisher

Name: Departure on the Nile
Description: Departure on the Nile puts 2 to 4 players in the 1830s to 1880s in Egypt. During this period, Egypt under its rulers and the increased influence of Europeans experienced a tremendous upswing. The first railway lines were built, cotton was grown and exported, the Suez Canal was opened, as well as schools and hospitals built on the European model. Not least, the country also opened up for the emerging mass tourism, which brought a large number of people in the land of the pharaohs and pyramids. The players in Departure on the Nile embody young investors from Europe who want to contribute to the expansion of the country and invest in the Egyptian economy, solely with the aim of achieving the greatest fortune. Departure on the Nile is a classic worker placement game in which each player starts the game with only three of their own colonial officials. The construction of buildings, however, bring specialists into the country, who can recruit players using a novel mechanism (felucca travel and rail travel) and from now on can use. The game comes with a high level of interaction so it does not have the character of a multiplayer solitaire game. All players are involved at all times, whether through the use of the buildings (owners receive a bonus), by rail travel or the use of the Suez Canal where players can receive money and influence through their share certificates. Since the game is all about earning the most money at the end of the game, every investment in the game should be well considered. The game material is relatively extensive, the random game structure (bonus tiles, majority tiles, building tiles, personalities) guarantees a long game stimulus that prevents deadlocked strategies.

Name: Second Bull Run 1862
Description:
"Second Bull Run 1862" is an American Civil War board wargame for two players that simulates the main battle of the "Northern Virginia Campaign" during the summer of 1862 between General Lee for the South and General Pope for the North. Despite being outnumbered, Lee wins the 3-day combat and takes advantage of his good defensive position before launching a counter attack that disperses Pope’s troops. This simulation primarily uses the rules of the Sécession System (Vae Victis - American Civil War series) developed for Cedar Creek 1864 (VV94) and especially Stones River 1862 (VV121).

Complexity : 6/10
Playability for solo play : 7/10
One turn = 1.5 hours approximately
One counter  = one brigade

Published in Vae Victis wargame magazine, in issue #148.
Families: Players: Wargames with Rules Supporting Only Two Players

Name: Aristeia!: Reckless Hearts
Description:
From one of the Human Sphere ends comes Axl Steel, a fighter who practices a strange martial discipline, quite a mix of kickboxing, classic boxing and judo. During all his life, Axl has worked in one of the many orbital factories connected in the Human Edge System. Not long ago, his employers organized an illegal Aristeia! competition and Axl shined so much that they automatically decided to make him an AGL star.

Hippolyta’s character was created in close collaboration with Manu aka Kelthret, the first season AGL champion. He earned the right to participate in the design of an Aristeia! character. Manu shared with us his passion for the Infinity Myrmidons and suggested a Myrmidon Officer as a starting point. The result is a spectacular leader support, both in design and game profile.

In addition to including the two pre-assembled plastic miniatures with the highest quality Corvus Belli seal, this Aristeia! expansion incorporates the 2 character cards, the 2 initiative cards, 8 tactical cards and the necessary markers to play this expansion. A total of 42 cards in each box, since a copy is incorporated in each of the game's languages: Spanish, English, German and French.

—description from the publisher

Name: Rollecate: Broken Rails
Description:
This first mini-expansion of Rollecate adds a new challenge to the game: broken rails. The four new cards in the expansion replace cards from the base game, adding more challenge and difficulty. Every time the Rollecate crosses a broken rail, it will derail and force the active player to take an (extra) penalty card. This expansion allows players to build barricades for other players. But they will have to be careful not to become the victim of their own foul play!

—description from the publisher

Name: Escape Room: The Game 2
Description:
Feel the excitement of an Escape Room in your own living room with 4 new adventures of this Escape Room The Game 2!

Escape Room The Game 2 contains 4 new adventures (Panic on the Titanic, Dawn of the Zombies, Alice in Wonderland and Another Dimension) and an introduction game (The Basement).

Note:
This entry is for all of the editions that contain the 4 escape rooms mentioned above. In some languages, this was printed as the third expansion.

There are several other versions of this game, with a varying set of escape rooms. Each of these has a separate BGG entry:

     Escape Room: The Game 3 (US, UK as "Escape Room: The Game 2") Panic on the Titanic + Dawn of the Zombies + Alice in Wonderland
     Escape Room: Das Spiel 2 (German): Alice in Wonderland + Another Dimension + Wild West Express + The Break-In
     Escape Room: The Game â€“ Expansion 4 (Chinese): Panic on the Titanic, Alice in Wonderland, Another Dimension


And there are several versions numbered "2" with a completely different content:

     Escape Room: The Game (Escape Rooms II) (English): Secret Agent + Space Station + The Dentist
     Escape Room: The Game 2 (Spanish): Secret Agent + Space Station + The Dentist + Casino
     Escape Room: Spillet 2 (Norwegian, Czech): Secret Agent + Space Station + The Dentist + Murder Mystery
     ì´ìŠ¤ì¼€ì´í”„ ë£¸: 2íƒ„ (Escape Room: The Game 2) (Korean): Secret Agent + Space Station + The Dentist + Nuclear Countdown
Families: Series: Escape Room – The Game (Identity Games International B.V.)

Name: Warhammer 40,000 Dice Masters: Grombrindal's Fury Promo
Description:
Promo card included in White Dwarf magazine.

Adds a copy of Grombrindal's Fury Basic Action Card to your Dice Masters Game. Grombrindal's Fury deals 2 damage to target character die. You may then preroll this die. If it is an action face, you may repeat this effect.

Name: Etherfields: Thorn Knight
Description:
The Thorn Knight is not a standard additional character, such as the 4 basic ones (Gambler, Specialist, Tough Guy, Free Spirit) or fifth with the 5-player expansion(Reaper).

The Thorn Knight is an alternative and very specific character available to ALL players at any time. During any given game, any player may decide to play the Thorn Knight as his normal in-game character.

During that particular game, the player will not be using his standard character. Instead, his character's soul will enter this empty shell and guide this soulless Golem into its next adventure. The Ether acquired by this player will be an Ether belonging to the Thorn Knight. After the game, you will be able to spend that Eather to buy additional cards for the Thorn Knight (from the overall Action cards). The same goes for The Action cards won by this player during this game - they will enter the Thorn Knight's deck.

Players can take turns playing the Thorn Knight through different games, jointly and gradually expanding his starting deck, using his starting special abilities, and finally turning him into a powerful, full of combos, common weapon for special challenges.

—description from the publisher

Name: Etherfields: 5th Player Expansion
Description:
This expansion allows you to add a 5th player.

This is not only a 5th player expansion, but also an additional character to choose from for any other player count game. We called this character archetype Reaper.

This archetype will be based on wounds that this character has taken - the more, the better combos she will be able to execute. There will be multiple ways of using this to your advantage - either by full-on risky play or perhaps more focused on balance and getting a good healing deck build. The  Reaper will provide quite interesting mechanics for the whole team!

—description from the publisher

Name: Etherfields: Funeral Witch Campaign
Description:
Story

Funeral Witch is a very mysterious and dark figure, representing, among other things, sadness, pain and regret after a loss. She can be moody, chaotic, temperamental but still seeks solace - at each encounter her behaviour changes completely from the previous one. Will we discover the key to these changes? If so, will it be easier for us to prepare for the next encounter with her?

Fluctuation, but also cyclicality is the rhythm in which this campaign will be played. Will we drown in the depths of black sorrow, or will we find a ray of light that will lead us to a mysterious goal?

In this story we will be accompanied by drabness, darkness and ruins.

Gameplay

In this campaign, one of the main attractions, distinguishing it from the others, is a special additional 48-page Book of Scripts. Normally, in Etherfields, all adventures, scripts, conversations, scenes, etc. are placed directly on cards and tiles, and the amount of text is heavily balanced by graphics. Here, much more is pure text, and it is mainly used to conduct very extensive dialogues with the characters of this campaign.

Featured dream locations

We will climb the stairs and ride up in the old elevator to the highest floors of a crumbling, half-broken, block of flats.

We will come across a strange cemetery, located on the roof of a building.

We will visit the Museum of Death and the Great Cathedral.

We will struggle with the snow void.

And we will take part in a game of hide and seek.

—description from the publisher

Name: Barbarians: The Invasion – Mystics Set
Description:
The Mystics Set contains 3 new characters which each add their own rules and variety to the game:

Bones Diviner: The Bones Diviner's guidance is sought by all Clans. He prays and meditates for weeks at a time, just waiting for the players to meet him on the Honor track's milestones. Once reached by the most honorable player, the Bones Diviner grants them a bonus and calls forward the other Clans.

Trickster: The Trickster is a weird one. As it is true that a Clan may loathe him sometimes, it is also true that the other Clans are enjoying his show in the meanwhile...at least until it is their turn. The Trickster loves to fool around with the God, Warchief, and Building decks.

Time Weaver: The Time Weaver is a blessed and revered figure among the Clans, as only one in the whole world exists at any given time. She moves between the Volcano rings, and when a player's Champion finally meets her, they get the chance to grasp the future by performing actions from the ring below.  Sometimes though, some Champions get also to relive the past.

—description from the publisher

Name: Mumbai Estate
Description:
Each player secretly draws one out of five house colors. One of the remaining house colors is placed in the center of the 5x5 grid of the game board.

Each player has six windows. Five of them show the corresponding five house colors and one of them shows a compass rose. In their turn the player places their die on one of the windows to perform that action. They cannot use the action, which they performed in their previous turn.

When a player picks a colored window, they place a house in the corresponding color to the board. Depending on the setting of the black direction marker it must be placed horizontally or vertically adjacent to an existing house. A color circle determines which house color is allowed next to each other. For example, a brown house may only be build next to a gray or a yellow one.

When all houses of a player’s secret color have been build, that player  yells “toping” and wins the game.

Name: Mutopia: a game of ruin and redemption
Description:
The world is an irradiated wasteland, inhospitable to life. Hordes of bloodthirsty mutants roam this desolate hellscape in search of human flesh, but pockets of non-mutant survivors have managed to wait out the horror. They have gathered ranks, formed factions, and have emerged ready to rebuild utopia.

Gameplay
In Mutopia, each player represents a team of human survivors. Survivors are categorized by virtue—guts, brain, brawn, heart, and soul. Players must advance Survivors and build structures in order to ascend from their shabby Communes and achieve Utopia. However, the more structures they build, the better their chances of encountering the Skull of Ruin. Each time a Ruin is rolled, a Ruin card must be drawn and a skull token placed on the player’s survivor board. If a player’s board fills up before they reach 15 ascendency points, the player flips over their board and becomes….A MUTANT.

Objective
It takes guts, brains, brawn, heart, and soul to ascend in Mutopia. These are Virtues and the currency with which players advance Survivors and purchase Items and Structures. Structures and some Items are worth Ascendency Points. The first player to achieve 15 Ascendancy Points before filling all 10 spaces on their Survivor Board wins the game.

—description from the designer

Name: Exodus Trading Card Game: Converging Chasms
Description:
This set introduces the Harmony Rare card rarity for the first time. Secret Rares get a brand new foil treatment and are now textured, their 3D raised foiling follows the lines of the card artwork; this unique foil technology means it is embedded in the card itself rather than stamped on top of it. Secret Rares also have an improved pack-out ratio of 1 in every 4 boxes on average, or 3 per case, while Harmony Rares are found 1 per case as a case topper.

Lots of new things are introduced from a gameplay standpoint with this expansion, including new mechanics, Abilities and rarity effects. The set is optimized for both Constructed and Booster Draft formats with effects now being in every rarity tier all the way down to Common (you can draft Common symmetries unlike with Galaxy Tides).

Following the conclusion of the Crystal Forge storyline from the Exodus TCG Official Magazine Issue #2, turmoil is abundant on Eeventide when it is disturbed to the point where its portals are thrown off course and start colliding into each other. These collisions create massive rips and tears in the fabric of space and time, opening up a new form of dimensional travel. However, these dimensional rifts signify permanent damage to Eeventide's atmosphere. Sentient smoke-like creatures called Chronos spill into the world soon after. The Chronos' are seen ripping apart portals, further destroying the shortcuts available to Drifters. But the biggest secret of all lies within the planet itself. It's well known by this point that Eeventide has a will of its own, but what exactly will happen when the very landscapes are called to rise up to defend themselves...?

Set Breakdown:

This set consists of 91 cards, including:
        3 Harmony Rares
        8 Secret Rares
        31 Rares
        22 Uncommons
        27 Commons

Of the 8 Secret Rares, one of them (Grandaria, Forger of Songs) can only be found as a fixed box topper in sealed booster boxes and not in packs themselves.
        The other 7 Secret Rares have a packaging ratio of 1 in every 4 boxes, or 3 per case.

Box Toppers

Box Toppers are extra/bonus cards included as incentive when opening an entire booster box or display.
        Box Toppers are always Foil.
        1 of the 2 Box Toppers in every box is "fixed", meaning it is the same card in every box.
        The 2nd Box Topper is a random Foil from the booster set (Uncommon or higher).

Sneak Peek Creature Types

Continuing a trend from the first booster set, there is a hidden pattern in each booster set that identify which new creature types the storyline will focus on in the near future. The pattern is 1 of that creature type in each main Rarity tier (Common, Uncommon & Rare) within the set (excluding dual-types). For Converging Chasms, the new preview types are Chrono & Machine.

Creature Types

This set introduces the following creature types:

- Chrono
  - Stag
  - Owl
  - Octopus
  - Bull

Name: Exodus Trading Card Game: The Dimension That Disappeared
Description:
The Dimension That Disappeared is the 3rd booster pack and the 5th overall set in the Exodus TCG.

Details

This set introduced the Afterthought mechanic as a new secondary Ability featured exclusively on Chrono creatures. Rares started getting their Ability & Ability Name hot stamped to further enhance their foil treatment. Secret Rares continued with their 3D raised foil treatment and their pull ratio of 1 in every 4 booster boxes, or 3 per case. No new Harmony Rares were introduced as they were deemed exclusive to Set 4 Converging Chasms. The set instead brought massive support for a few Guilds, specifically focusing on Chronos, Treefolk and Shardfolk--even going so far as to mix the latter two's mechanics. This expansion set also assigns the new Box Topper Rare title to the box topper card, replacing its old Secret Rare title; this change was made due to the single SR that always comes as a box topper having a Rare foil treatment rather than the usual treatment for the SR rarity tier. Box Topper Rares have a 'fixed' pull ratio, meaning they always appear at the same rate, 1 per box and cannot be found in packs themselves.

The booster display packaging was overhauled to a shorter 2-column box, doing away with the Styrofoam filler that was found in older booster boxes.

'Scaling' effects are introduced in this expansion; effects & Abilities that become more powerful depending on if the player pays additional cost(s) or is playing with a teammate in Multiplayer format. The set is optimized for both Constructed and Booster Draft formats.

The planet's landscapes shaped themselves into 3 different, massive creatures in an effort to annihilate the legion of Chronos invading from a lost dimension. Eeventide's will manifested in the form of the 3 Harmony Rares during the war, causing temporary alliances between Guilds. But as portals continued to collide and Chronos infected Drifters and creatures alike, Treeforge Guild Leader Oliver Rose fought against the smoky onslaught. He used his Psylerran powers to seal off the dimensional rift between Eeventide and The Dimension That Disappeared...only to discover that another Guild Leader also took it upon herself to dive into the forsaken dimension at the last moment. Crystallus, the Shardveil Guild's tyrannical leader, was exposed as a puppet to the real Shardveil Guild Leader, Lucia Lievdrahs. Together, she and Oliver Rose must navigate the severed dimension to vanquish the source of Chronos' destruction and find a way back to Eeventide before they are trapped for all of eternity.

Set Breakdown:

This set consists of 77 cards, including:
        1 Box Topper Rare
        8 Secret Rares
        27 Rares
        18 Uncommons
        23 Commons

The 8 Secret Rares have a packaging ratio of 1 in every 4 booster boxes, or 3 per booster case.
        The Box Topper Rare (End of the Rift) can only be found as a fixed box topper in sealed booster boxes and not in packs themselves.

Box Toppers

Box Toppers are extra/bonus cards included as incentive when opening an entire booster box or display.
        Box Toppers are always Foil.
        1 of the 2 Box Toppers in every box is "fixed", meaning it is the same card in every box.
        The 2nd Box Topper is a random Foil from the booster set (Uncommon or higher).
        A new rule card explaining the Afterthought mechanic is included as a 3rd card with Box Toppers in this set.
        The Box Topper Rare rarity tier is the equivalent rarity to a regular Rare, placing it below Secret Rare and Harmony Rare on the rarity mechanic latter.

Sneak Peek Creature Types & Product Pattern

The trend of previewing upcoming factions has continued since the first booster set. However, that pattern has been shaken up with this set; Set 4 hinted at Chronos and Machines being the next fully supported creature types. While this set does contain full support for Chronos, Machines' new mechanic has not yet been spoiled and will see support in Set 6. The sneak preview creature types in this set that will gain full support in a future set are Machines & Leviathans. Additionally, the alternating product pattern of decks & boosters was switched up with two back to back booster releases.

Creature Types

This set introduces the following creature types:

- Crow
  - Peacock

Name: Les Rois Francs: Roncevaux
Description:
A la charge is a an introductory level tactical medieval wargame.

A la charge: Roncevaux offers 3 scenarii for Les Rois Francs
Roncevaux 778 - the Death of Roland
Roncevaux 812 - the last submission of Pampelune
Roncevaux 824 - independence of the Basque country

It includes a map(A4) and 18 counters

Ownership of Les Rois Francs(VV 100) is needed to play this scenario and it is recommended to use the rules from Furor Barbarus (VV109)

As with other A la Charge wargames, Zone of Control, hex to hex moves, command, long range fire and close combat (melee), morale checks and retreats are used.

A battle lasts between 30-60 mins
Families: Players: Wargames with Rules Supporting Only Two Players

Name: Die verflixte 7!
Description:
Each player rolls 2 dice. On the roll of 4, 6, 8 or 10 the meeple is placed on space 1. On the roll of 1, 2 or 12 it is placed on space 2. All other rolls are fails.

To move a meeple 1 space ahead, the player has to roll a 4, 6, 8 or 10. A 1, 2 or 12 moves the meeple 2 spaces ahead.

On the roll of a 7 the meeple is moved 1 space backwards. To reach space 6, 8 and 12, special rules must be observed.

The first player to reach space 12 wins the game.

—user summary

Name: Village Attacks: Grim Dynasty – Reborn
Description:
It appears…there are many places where evil calls home. In far off lands, both ancient and vast, live yet more otherworldly creatures that terrify and prey upon the mortals of this world. But wherever there is oppression, the seeds of defiance will take root and grow...

Village Attacks: Grim Dynasty is a brand new expansion to the hit fully co-operative castle defence game, steeped in the folklore of ancient China. Players must continue the ceaseless war with the mortal realm, taking on the roles of Monsters and defending their home from the near-endless waves of villagers who seek to end you once and for all!

Grim Dynasty introduces new Monsters to play as and Town Heroes to combat, as well as entirely new Villager types to contend with! The Militia are a poorly trained and disorganised rabble, but with the new Tactics mechanics a Tactician can enter play at any time and order them to execute devastating manoeuvres!

But the Monsters have their own new tricks. Artefacts can be strategically placed around the castle and bolster the already inhuman talents of the monsters that reside in the castle…

—description from the publisher

Name: Bear Yourselves Valiantly: Look, Sarge, No Charts – Fantasy, Ancient, and Mediaeval
Description:
Bear Yourselves Valiantly is the fourth rule set to feature the Look, Sarge, No Charts! rule system. BYV features dynamic mechanics that allow the players to fight the battle, not the rules. In these rules “realism” is gained through simple mechanics that stress the players’ decision making. BYV provides period feel without pages of onerous charts or cumbersome rules.

... And best of all, there are NO CHART CARDS to detract from the fun, clutter the aesthetics of your table, or slow down the game.

Whether you are new to the Look, Sarge, No Charts! rule system or a fan, whether you are an aficionado of the period or a newcomer, when you play BYV, you will be challenged and excited.

—description from the publisher
Families: Series: Look, Sarge, No Charts! (LMW Works)

Name: Fate of Battle: Look, Sarge, No Charts – Napoleonic Wars
Description:
Buck’s first real wargaming love was the Napoleonic Wars. This is his third set of published Napoleonic rules.  Battles for Empire was designed for those Empire-sized games. Wellington Rules was designed for much smaller games, in which players commanded brigade.  Fate of Battle is designed for larger games in which which players command one or more divisions. Like all the Look, Sarge family of rules, this game moves!

Fate of Battle is the most complex of the Look, Sarge family.  We’ve worked hard to remain true to the fell of the series, but we’ve incorporated formations, skirmishing, and other period feel. You’ll get the paper, scissors, rock of infantry, cavalry, and artillery in columns, lines, and squares.

Many gamers are turned off by the Napoleonic Wars.  Years of pedantic, plodding, overly complex rules and the angry rules lawyers those systems seem to attract have convinced many gamers we know that the Napoleonic Wars cannot be fun to game. Members of our gaming club who have sworn off the period enjoy these rules and play them regularly.

—description from the publisher
Families: Series: Look, Sarge, No Charts! (LMW Works)

Name: Pando: The Family History Game
Description:
A game ain which players attempt to answer questions about their family history.  As each question is asked, the first to answer correctly scores a point. The first player to score five points wins.

The "Elders" (usually Mom and Dad, or Grandma and Grandpa) are those who will ask questions and who those questions will be about.

The "Progeny" is everyone else (typically family members).

Later rebranded as "Pando: Family History Edition" after the success of Pando: The Trivia Game About Us.

Name: Bull Frog
Description:
Be the first to hop your team of frogs from your PUDDLE, around the board to safety in your BIG POOL. Each turn you’ll choose a frog to move exactly the roll of the die. If you roll a 1 or 6 you may bring a new frog into play from your PUDDLE to your STEPPING STONE (the first space on your journey around the board). But be careful as enemy frogs can TAG each other by landing on their space. The TAGGED frog is sent back to their start PUDDLE. You can also leap over enemy frogs. You cannot tag your own frogs or leap over them, so you have to manage your frogs carefully so that they don’t get bunched up. Moves must always be exactly the number of spaces indicated by the roll of the die. A roll of 1 or 6 always gives you another turn no matter how many times it occurs. If you have only one possible move, you must take it. If you have no legal moves, you pass your turn.

Once a player Fills up their BIG POOL by moving all of their frogs into it, they win!

The game can also be played in teams of 2 vs 2. When one player’s frogs are all safe they may move their teammates. TEAMMATES FROGS MAY TAG EACH OTHER! So take care that it is not the only option.

Name: Handy-Handy
Description:
The game includes a board with a 5x8 grid, four large and four small cardboard mobile phones, four differently-colored pawns, 40 cardboard mobile phone keys (0 to 9 in the four player colors, with the same number, but black background on the backside), a regular six-sided die and a notepad.

Every player first receives the large and then the small cardboard mobile phone as well as a note sheet. They secretly write down a secret message to the player who has with the large mobile phone in the corresponding color. The message should consist of exactly 10 words.

The 40 keys are turned to the black side, shuffled and randomly distributed to the 40 fields of the game board. Starting with their pawn at the positions marked with an arrow, the players play alternately in clockwise order. At first, they roll a dice and move their pawn according to the rolled number in any direction (horizontal or vertical, but not diagonal). The direction can be changed once during the turn. If the pawn ends his turn on a key, it is turned over. If it shows the player’s color, they place it on the corresponding key of their large cardboard mobile phone and the player who wrote the message to that player tells the nth word corresponding to the number on the key. If the front of the key has a different color, the player puts the key next to their own mobile phone and no word is revealed. If the player rolled a 6, they get an additional turn.

To receive the missing keys which are collected by the other players, they have to capture the pawns of this player. When a pawn is captured, is returns to the start position and the capturing player steals a key of their choice from that player.

When player believes to know their sentence they yell “Stop!”. After the turn of the current player, they have to guess the sentence and if it is correct, win the game.

Name: Frankenstein: Madmen and Monsters
Description:
Frankenstein:  Madmen and Monsters is an asymmetric hidden Roles Board Game, based on the Frankenstein Mythos.

Take the role of character from the book/movies created by Mary Shelley and reach your unique objective before anyone else and change the tragedy we all know (or make it worse!).

Each player take a secret character and a hand of 3 resource cards. The first player to achieve the goal of it´s character wins and the game ends!

The game is divided in 3 phases:

1. Collect, In which you play a card to gather resources with an unique system that allows you to receive resources from adjacent players (you give them resources too).

2. Hire, You will hire a service in one of the 8 available locations (2 possible actions per location), which will be resolved in the next phase.

Interlude: You can reveal your secret character to activate an unique power and get close to your objective.

3. Survive, The hired actions resolve in location order, hurting some players, protecting others or giving you that advantage you need to achieve victory

Includes 8 characters with gorgeous illustrations, each with a different goal and power, 8 locations to hire different effects, 32 ticket cards to manage resources (with an unique balance mechanic) and 8 player boards to track resources.

—description from the designer

Name: Trivial Pursuit: Poitou-Charentes
Description:
The famous trivia game. The questions are about the French region of Poitou Charentes.

There are 3000 questions in 6 different themes; History, Geography, Science and Nature, Art and Literature, Entertainment and Sports and Leisure.
Each player has a circular playing piece with six pie-shaped holes. The goal of the game is to collect a pie in each color. The colors correspond to different question categories.

The board consists of a circular track with spaces in seven different colors. Six of the colors correspond to question categories while the last color gives a new dice roll. Six spaces along the track are "pie spaces", and from these there are "spokes" of track leading to the middle of the board.

Players roll a die and move along the track in any direction they like. When a player stops on a color they get a question of the appropriate category. If the player answers a question correctly while on a pie space, they get a pie of that color (assuming they don't already have it). A correct answer on another square allows the player to roll again.

Once the player has one pie in each color, she can move along the spokes to the middle of the board to win the game.

Name: Tussie Mussie: Flower Shoppe
Description:
You are the proud owner of a quaint little neighborhood flower shoppe. Business has been going so well that it's time to hire some help. While you're training your new employee you'll help to assemble their bouquets while at the same time making it clear who's in charge!

Flower Shoppe is a solo expansion for Tussie Mussie, consisting of 6 Turn Cards that will determine how cards are dealt and how you must distribute cards between yourself and your opponent. Each round your opponent gets to keep a card making it harder and harder as you go.


A 6-card solo expansion included for free for Kickstarter backers of Tussie Mussie (but available for purchase through the Button Shy Games website).

Name: Adellos: Immoral Offer
Description:
Immoral Offer is the first expansion for Adellos and comes with the following contents:

5 white dice to count down incantations and stuns
25 AP tracker tiles to track player action points
1 small gray die to track bonus rounds
4 new event cards, new rules and errata

Name: Party Bandimals
Description:
Have you ever dreamed about starting your own band and living the rock life? Party Bandimals gives you the experience of being the band manager with the important job of scouting out the best talent for your band of animals. You will be playing against other managers who are trying to add the best musical animals to their band, while trying to push the worst musicians to your band.

Party Bandimals is best for 2-4 players and takes about 15 minutes to play, but only minutes to learn! Do you have what it takes to make your band a success?

Goal
In Party Bandimals, you play as the role of a band manager. Your goal is to be the first manager to assemble a band with 11 points. You get points by playing good members into your band but beware other players can play bad members into 
your band lowering your score. If the cards run out the player with the highest score wins.

Setup
Deal each player 3 cards. Each player should discard any 'Play When Drawn' cards and draw back up to three cards. 
The player who played an instrument last goes first.

How to play
On your turn you must draw up to four cards and play one card.  If you draw a 'Play when drawn' card, it must be the card you play. Good members can only be played in your band and bad band members can only be played into another players band. Played cards are placed in front of you, thus forming your band, or in front of another player when adding bad band members to their band.

—description from the publisher

Name: Plan Core: Pathfinder
Description:
Plan Core: Pathfinder is a strategy game designed and published by C.O.R.E Lab.

In the year 2131, due to the exhaustion of resources on the earth, human beings have to seek settlement on other planets than the earth in the solar system. There has been a kind of special resource named "core" (as it is exploited from the earth core), which is of great use in the process of seeking settlement, so the UN releases the plan "core".

In this plan, players represent giant companies of space science & technology, sending airships to explore, exploit and finally settle on planets of the solar system. The game lasts for several rounds, with each round composed of a Plan Phase and a Implementation Phase. At the end of the game, the player with the most victory points is the best space settler, that is to say, the winner of the game.

Plan Core is a series of strategic board games, and Pathfinder is the first game in this series.

—description from the publisher

Name: Quadrant: Adventure in Mirva
Description:
Quadrant is a CCG game for 2 players. 
The heart of Quadrant is the Quadrant mechanism : all players roll a dice and choose their actions available in their hands(and each card has 4 available actions!), and more choice will be available with more dice point. This unique system of quadrant maximize the strategic nature of your adventure.

Players choose their hero and pick 5 disposition cards. This makes the tendency of hero. And each players construct their own deck with various cards pool.

And 5-line battle field system makes fast-paced game play possible.

-2021.03.27

—description from the designer

Name: Warhammer Age of Sigmar: Order Battletome – Cities of Sigmar
Description:
The Cities of Sigmar are blazing strongholds of light and hope amidst the deadly wilds of the Mortal Realms.

Battletome: Cities of Sigmar is your guide to the mightiest bastions of Order in the mortal realms – and the grand armies of humans, aelves and duardins that bravely fight to defend them. Inside, you'll discover just what life is like for the Mortal Realms’ “ordinary” inhabitants – the countless sub-cultures, guilds and tribal groups that band together to fight for Sigmar and the pantheon of Order. Rich art, lore and seven short stories penned by renowned Black Library author Josh Reynolds bring the world of the Cities of Sigmar to life.

Meanwhile, a vast set of allegiance abilities and faction rules allow you to field powerful combined forces of Order units themed around the seven most famous Cities of Sigmar. Perhaps you’ll harness the myriad war machines of the Greywater Fastness, or field a rapid-strike force from Tempest’s Eye – the choice is yours, and with warscroll battalions, artefacts and dozens of warscrolls to choose from, the possibilities are endless. What’s more, you'll find loads of top painting tips, colour schemes, bespoke missions, Path to Glory rules and more – this is the ultimate resource for any Cities of Sigmar collector!

This 128-page hardback book contains:

     A history of how the Cities of Sigmar were founded, including guides to the seven greatest metropolises in the realms
     Seven thrilling stories penned by renowned Black Library author Josh Reynolds
     Tips for collecting Cities of Sigmar Citadel miniatures and rules that allow you to fight battles with them on the tabletop
     54 warscrolls representing the citizenry of the Cities of Sigmar * humans, aelves and duardin alike
     Allegiance abilities that bestow a wide selection of battle traits, command traits, artefacts of power and unique spell lores upon your Cities of Sigmar collection
     A battleplan representing the heroic efforts of a Cities of Sigmar army to relieve an ally besieged by the forces of darkness
     Rules themed around the seven most famous Cities of Sigmar, as well as a powerful warscroll battalion for each city


—description from the publisher

Name: Z Day Survivor: Per Ullus Opes
Description:
Z Day Survivor: Per Ullus Opes ("By any means") is a turn based game of strategy and luck that features 8 unique characters for varying styles of play. Using a one-of-a-kind Zombie Survival Kit, track the spread of the virus, bonuses to movement, and organize items collected during your journey to become...the Z Day Survivor.

—description from the publisher

The city is cut off. No help is coming. Will you be bitten or will you fight, cheat, and steal your way to victory to become... the Z Day Survivor?  Eight survivors trapped in a hospital receive an emergency broadcast, warning that no help is coming. The only chance for survival is to escape anyway you can to an extraction point near the far edge of town. There's just one catch --- salvation is on a first come, first serve basis and seats are in short supply.

The strategy is simple: MOVE, SCAVENGE, FIGHT.  Each player enacts his turn in three phases.

Move -- Traverse the terrain as quickly as you can. It's a race to be the first to escape.

Scavenge -- Gather items and search for vehicles necessary to help you get ahead of the crowd.

Fight -- Behind each corner waits looters ready to strip you of your supplies, displaced civilians that may need your help, and zombies ready to tear at your flesh. Along the way, help or hinder your opponents, but take great care not to be bitter, the zombie virus spreads quickly and there are only a limited number of antidotes in play.

—description from the box

Name: Ozeanien 3: Scotties Dschungeltour
Description:
Description: The goal of the game is to quickly overcome all obstacles in the jungle and reach the finish field. Exciting action fields complicate the jungle tour.
—description from the publisher

This Roll-and-move game was available for customers of the Danish supermarket chain Netto in Germany from September 2nd to October 12th in exchange for loyalty points.
—user summary

Name: Shadow Raiders: Expansion Set – Queen Majesty Airship
Description:
Shadow Raiders Expansion Set: Queen Majesty Airship is an expansion set that allows you to enjoy the board game "Shadow Raiders" in depth and battle. Added 20 characters!

The newly introduced "airship board" increases freedom of movement and attack, and promises a flashy deployment. In addition, it can support up to 10 players by adding the white / black / inference card of this work. Please enjoy "Shadow Raiders" all scaled up!

—description from the publisher

Name: Rugby Champion
Description:
Rugby Champion is a Fast-paced tactical card game based on the Rugby theme. This game was designed to be enjoyed with the whole family. It is a simple, tactical and very dynamic game. It will immerse you in a rugby match as if you were there. An essential card game, designed for those oval ball passionate fans as well as for beginners that you should own by the end of the year.
The game offers 3 different play modes for 1 to 4 players, with short rounds.

The game is divided by rounds called "challenges ". These challenges represent the phases of a classic rugby match. Each player therefore tries to win these challenges to be able to score tries, by playing the action cards based either on the power (Physical game), on the dexterity (Hand game), or on the technicality (foot game). But beware, the strongest cards are also the most risky and in case of a risky play the referee can intervene at any time and whistle to mark penalties! And that way, we chain actions and challenges. The player with the most points after 2 halves is declared the winner!

The game takes the form of a series of challenges:

     Physical and powerful challenge: simulates actions like rucks, scrums, etc.
     Hand Challenge: simulates skilful actions such as passes, interceptions, etc.
     Foot challenge: simulates tactical actions such as kicks, penalties, etc.


Despite the small size of our game, the dozens of card and tactical game combinations in 3 game modes (Solo, Duel or Conquest for 4 players) offer very good replay ability. In addition, because the game is played very fast, it is particularly suitable to play small tournaments or championships in less than one hour.

—description from the publisher

Name: Space Buccaneers
Description:
In Space Buccaneers, you start out as a lowly vagabond looking to make a living by running jobs out of Buccaneer’s Den and appealing to The Man… the head behind all illicit business that happens in this corner of the galaxy. Successfully deliver on your contracts to gain credit and renown; fail, and you’ll find The Man’s confidence in your capabilities will dip. Work to upgrade your menial starting ship and crew to better push your luck within the Galactic Underground Trading Route (GUTR) and become the richest, most famous freebooter of all!

Space Buccaneers is game about taking on jobs and attempting to deliver their cargo to the furthest location possible along the GUTR. The trading route is comprised of a series of planetary systems willing to do business with the Den. The further along the route that you deliver, the more credit and renown you will gain. Along the course, you’ll be attempting to resolve events by rolling dice provided by your ship and crew. These are resolved by matching the symbols on the event cards with the symbols on the dice. As you roll misses and are forced to set dice aside, you’ll have to decide if you risk pushing on to profit from greater gains or not. If you roll too many misses, your delivery attempt will be cut short and your reputation will suffer. Events get harder as you press along the GUTR; the better your ship and crew the better your odds. The game ends when one of the players reaches the renown threshold. After which, players will have a chance to complete their turns, and the player with the highest amount of renown will be declared the victor.

—description from the publisher

Name: 転がる芝浜 (The after story of "Shibahama")
Doctor Who: Exterminate! The Miniatures Game – Voyage of the Damned
Description: This expansion adds characters from the Voyage of the Damned episode to Doctor Who: Exterminate! The expansion includes five miniatures, four faction cards, and three new adventure cards to expand the Doctor Who: Exterminate! universe.

Name: Doctor Who: Exterminate! The Miniatures Game – The Tomb of the Cybermen
Description: This expansion adds Cybermen from The Tomb of the Cybermen episode to Doctor Who: Exterminate! The expansion includes five miniatures, four Cybermen faction cards, and six new adventure cards to expand the Doctor Who: Exterminate! universe.

Name: Trump Roast
Description:
Trump Roast is a meat-themed party game designed to help America solve the most ridiculous global policies. Trump Roast game is played with a minimum of 3 players and can be played with 12 or more. This game uses real Trump quotes, combined with Fake News, Veto, Collusion cards and complete with Trump cards for extra entertainment.

Use many of Donald's "best words" to choose his Position to the most ridiculous Policy questions that our celebrity president will be pre-occupied with while he's supposed to be leading our nation and making it great again. Packed with all the classic quotes and many nearly forgotten gems, Trump Roast game tackles many important policy questions including:


     What does Donald have tattooed on his lower back?
     What is the chorus to Ted Nugent's next single?
     What does Donald yell when he shanks a drive at Mar-a-Lago?
     How will Donald greet the world champion Green Bay Football Packers?
     When Mike Pence's gay conversion therapy stops working, what is the backup line?
     What are Melania's first words every morning?
     How will Donald pardon the Thanksgiving turkey?
     Dear Diary...


and many more!

Choose your favorite position quote to answer these important celebrity policy questions, score points and you too can be leader of the free world.

Coming to Kickstarter January 28th, 2020

Name: It sucks!
Description:
A cooperative card game using a standard playing card deck.

When a player draws a card, he can not keep it to himself and has to decide to which other player he wants to give it to.

The game is about all the players helping each other to be sure they can win Goal cards.

—description from the designer

Name: Warhammer Quest: Blackstone Fortress – Cultists of the Abyss
Description:
An Abominable Intellect rises in the Blackstone Fortress, attracting more hostiles from their dark hiding places. Are you ready for the challenge?

These models were originally released in Blackstone Fortress: Escalation. They are perfect for use as hostiles with the Abominable Intellect cards, which increase the difficulty level of your quests in the Blackstone Fortress, or as models in a Warhammer 40,000 Chaos Army. Rules for using these models in Warhammer 40,000 can be found in Blackstone Fortress: Escalation.

Contents:

     1 Cultist Firebrand
     1 Cultist Champion
     6 Chaos Cultists


—description from the publisher

Name: Warhammer Quest: Blackstone Fortress – Servants of the Abyss
Description:
An Abominable Intellect rises in the Blackstone Fortress, attracting more hostiles from their dark hiding places. Are you ready for the challenge?

These models were originally released in Warhammer Quest: Blackstone Fortress. They are perfect for use as hostiles with the Abominable Intellect cards, which increase the difficulty level of your quests in the Blackstone Fortress, or as models in a Warhammer 40,000 Chaos Army. Rules for using these models in Warhammer 40,000 can be found in Warhammer Quest: Blackstone Fortress.

Contents:

     2 Chaos Beastmen with a choice alternate torsos. Supplied with 32mm round bases
     1 Chaos Space Marine with a choice of a bare or helmeted head. Supplied with 32mm round base
     1 Rogue Psyker with a choice of two alternate bodies. Supplied with 32mm round base
     2 Ur-Ghuls. Supplied with 32mm round bases
     2 Negavolt Cultists. Supplied with 32mm round bases
     2 Spindle Drones. Supplied with 25mm round bases
     7 Traitor Guardsmen. Supplied with 25mm round bases


—description from the publisher

Name: Warhammer Quest: Blackstone Fortress – Abominable Intellect
Description:
An Abominable Intellect rises in the Blackstone Fortress to challenge even the most experienced of adventurers.

The rules in this set allow you to increase the difficulty of your Warhammer Quest Blackstone Fortress games, and present fresh tests in the form of nightmarish twists and an increased hostile presence.

Contents:

     34 new encounter cards and a rules card which explains how to play the game in Challenging or Abominable modes.
     9 additional encounter cards for use with the Dreaded Ambull, Traitor Command and Escalation expansions.


—description from the publisher

Name: Secret Cthulhu
Description:
The year is unknown. The place is somewhere on Earth. In Secret Cthulhu players are attempting to stop Cthulhu devouring the planet by enacting enough Rites of Salvation to protect the planet and all that currently live on it. Watch out though, there are secret Cultists among you, and one player is possessed by Cthulhu himself. These Cultists will be doing everything in their power to pave the way for Cthulhu, and the destruction and chaos he brings with him.

At the beginning of the game each player is assigned one of three roles: Cultist, Investigator, or Cthulhu. The Investigators have a majority, but they don’t know for sure who anyone is; Cultists must resort to what they know best to accomplish their goals: secrecy and sabotage. Cthulhu plays for the Cultists, and the Cultists know Cthulhu’s identity, but Cthulhu isn’t always aware of who his fellow Cultists are and must work to figure them out.

If that's not enough, you need to be ready for whatever the Chaos Deck throws your way.

—description from the designer

Name: Skytear: Kurumo
Description:
This is a faction-expansion box for the Skytear MOBA boardgame. The expansion contains:

4 Hero Miniatures (38mm)
4 Hero Cards (63x88mm)
32 Power Cards (63x88mm) — a pre-built deck

You can use these contents to challenge a friend with the starter box. Or you can freely mix and combine these heroes and cards with your existing Skytear collection.

Martial honor is the creed of Kurumo’s warriors, a creed made tangible in their blades. 
Ushered on by the whispers of his blade, Akimo’s devastating strikes can tear down any foe.
Hogosai’s unparalleled defense is backed up by scorching flame.
The hermit Kichie drains his foes’ vitality, strengthening as they wither and die.
The spirits inside Miyuki’s lantern can terrify foes into paralysis, or heal the dying.

—description from the publisher

Name: Skytear: Liothan
Description:
This is a faction-expansion box for the Skytear MOBA boardgame. The expansion contains:

4 Hero Miniatures (38mm)
4 Hero Cards (63x88mm)
32 Power Cards (63x88mm) — a pre-built deck

You can use these contents to challenge a friend with the starter box. Or you can freely mix and combine these heroes and cards with your existing Skytear collection.

The Shapeshifters of Liothan can alter form at will, allowing them great strength when hunting.
Shyllavi is her home personified, a deadly predator bent on defending her own.
Freyhel, Queen of Grialth, takes life with the same ease with which she grants it.
The siren Astryda twists the minds of her foes of battle, turning the tide against them.
Brylvar’s taunts force his foes to strike him. His scales scatter their blades.

—description from the publisher

Name: Skytear: Nupten
Description:
This is a faction-expansion box for the Skytear MOBA boardgame. The expansion contains:

4 Hero Miniatures (38mm)
4 Hero Cards (63x88mm)
32 Power Cards (63x88mm) — a pre-built deck

You can use these contents to challenge a friend with the starter box. Or you can freely mix and combine these heroes and cards with your existing Skytear collection.

The laws that govern the world are broken by the minds of Nupten’s devotees. 
Shafathi’s temporal instability has been mastered, now his greatest skill.
Lord Setheru holds dominion over Skytear, turning foes to ash at a word.
Ekhrit dominates the winds; each of her attacks blows away its victims.  
Khenui dances alongside illusions as her enemies try, and fail, to strike true.

—description from the publisher

Name: Skytear: Taulot
Description:
This is a faction-expansion box for the Skytear MOBA boardgame. The expansion contains:

4 Hero Miniatures (38mm)
4 Hero Cards (63x88mm)
32 Power Cards (63x88mm) — a pre-built deck

You can use these contents to challenge a friend with the starter box. Or you can freely mix and combine these heroes and cards with your existing Skytear collection.

The heroes of Taulot strike from the tunnels of their home, their innate hivemind.
Zacoal, malformed by Skytear designed to empower him, overpowers any invader.
Older than any other, Nelaclan can cast any spell, wielding powers long forgotten.
Charged with preventing entry to the realm, Achla is a master ambusher.
A rumbling is all the warning foes get before Ixatosk emerges from its burrows.

—description from the publisher

Name: Skytear: Outsiders
Description:
This is a neutral-expansion box for the Skytear MOBA boardgame. The expansion contains:

4 Outsider Miniatures (38mm)
4 Outsider Cards (63x88mm)
48 Power Cards (63x88mm)
The additional Outsiders will add even more replayability to your matches.
The 48 Power Cards improve your deck-building options to further personalize the heroes in your Skytear collection.

Each outsider in this expansion was a hero, now consumed by the power of Skytear.
Gulbjarn, Terror of the Endless Night, stalks the wilds, crippling his foes with fear.
Haburat, Dark Vigilante, deals a deadly series of strikes, never ceasing his pursuit. 
Cotlic, Lord of The Ancestors, will stop at nothing to conquer the lane for his glory.
Akimo, infamous Scourge of Puido possesses a hero, driving them to violence at the cost of their own life.

—description from the publisher

Name: トリ天気 (Trick-Take BIRD & WEATHER)
Description:
Stable weather attracts various birds. And the birds call their friends. Everyone is trying to dominate in a corner of a small neighborhood.

"Trick-Take BIRD & WEATHER" is a trick-taking game where the tens digit represents the weather, and the ones digit represents different birds.  However, functionally, the cards do not have suits. Players must follow the lead card with a card that shares either the same tens digit or ones digit as the card that was led, if they can.  The highest card which followed will win the trick, and the player earns a number of points equal to the lowest ones digit of all cards played.

However, there are certain exceptions when the tens digit is a 1 where the low card may win the trick, and the highest ones digit may be the points awarded.  There are additional exceptions when the tens digit of all cards played match, or when the card that would be scored has a 0 in the ones digit.

The game plays over one round (nine tricks), and the player with the highest score wins.

Enjoy a new & strange type trick-taking game.

Name: A Wizard's Shelf
Description:
Players seek to prove they are the most esteemed wizard in the land by filling their shelves with similar types of ingredients and completing spells. Players draft cards from center stacks in an attempt to build out their shelf tableau and unlock new scoring mechanics. Players can also use abilities from spells to change up the game and their collection of ingredients.

When all the cards are drafted players tally up points based on their unlocked scoring and adjacent similar ingredients. Players also lose points if they match up items of the same color.

Name: Kampf gegen das Spießertum: Shot Erweiterung
Description: 100 brand new cards for Kampf gegen das Spießertum. 20 Cards are alcohol themed and marked, if one of them is played, everyone has to drink.

Name: Trick or Boo
Description:
It's Halloween night, and right after sunset the local ghosts awake and start moving around the houses of the neighborhood. They are the stars of the night, and they know this is one unique opportunity per year to do crazy things and scare the neighbors. And as they do every year, our naughty ghosts will start a competition to see which ghost haunts more houses. Who will be the scariest ghost this Halloween?

Trick or Boo is a family game in which the players are frightening ghosts celebrating the Halloween night as they enjoy the most: scaring the neighbors and haunting their houses! Each turn the players move their ghosts through the houses of the neighborhood, trying to scare the residents by winning fun challenges. If a ghost is able to scare the neighbors, it will gain control over that house. But be careful as the other ghosts could challenge you in order to take your haunted houses from you...

—description from the publisher

Name: Criminal City
Description:
Criminal City, 2019.

Here, every day, the eternal struggle between the Law and the "Interstellar Mob" is rekindled without respite and shows no signs of dying out, also due to the scarce resources available to the police.

The 3 powerful interstellar criminal factions are fighting to command the entire city, fueling the black market, the corruption and the sense of insecurity of citizens, while few but brave space policemen face them every day to try to stop them.

And which side are you on?

Criminal City is a partially asymmetrical and semi-collaborative game for 3-6 players divided into a number of rounds depending on the number of players participating.

In each game a single player chose to be the head of a criminal faction(in this case he is playing as a "Interstellar Mob" Player) or, alternatively, can control policemen (1 or more, depending on the number of players).

The players who lead the criminal factions win individually by accumulating more Dominion Points (DP) than their rivals and trying not to be arrested by the space police. 
The policemen win if they manage to capture all the factions fighting for the city's control within two consecutive turns or if, at the end of the game, they managed to limit the Criminals by accumulating at least 5 DP more than the most powerful faction.

—description from the designer

Name: Cards of Olympus
Description:
Build your army and defeat your fellow Gods to conquer Olympus.

In Cards of Olympus, Players share one deck of split-face, two-sided cards representing Mortals, Heroes, Gods, and Monsters that they can enlist to earn victory points and defeat their opponent. New cards can be purchased to build up the deck and cards can be upgraded to rotate or flip the cards. Doing so not only changes your future actions and resources but your opponents, creating a unique push-pull dynamic.

Name: Imminent Collapse
Description:
Imminent Collapse is a cooperative strategy game where players work together as the special operations team, Black Falcon. The team must gather Intel, secure designated Target Sites, and clear Rebel strongholds while managing their collective resources as well as mission time.

Game Play Overview

     Arrange the 9 Sector tiles in any configuration.
     Draw cards from the game deck to establish the sites of the Rebels, Intel, and Targets and place the colored cubes on those sites. Return those cards to the deck and shuffle it.
     Each player will draw a certain number of cards to start the game.
     Based on the locations of the Rebels, Intel, and Targets, players will place the Insertion and Extraction tiles adjacent to any of the Sector Tiles. All players start the game at the Insertion Point.
     The game is divided into three 10 day Phases.  Players try to acquire Intel cubes in Phase 1 and Rebel/Target cubes in Phase 1 and 2. The cubes can be used in Phase 3 to acquire various special abilities.
     Each player can take three actions per turn. These actions include opening a Portal, acquiring Intel, capturing a Rebel, neutralizing a Target, trading cards with other players, or moving from one site to another. All actions can be repeated during a turn. 
     At the end of a turn, players can discard any number of cards and draw additional cards to meet the hand limit.
     When all players have completed their turns, the Mission Tracker is advanced one day. By the end of Day 30, players must capture all Rebels, neutralized all targets, opened Portals at the Insertion and Extraction Points, and returned to the Extraction Point in order to win the game.


—description from the publisher

Name: Catan Histories: Struggle for Rome – Terror of the Legions expansion
Description: This free web-published mini-expansion features 3 Terror of the Legions cards. Each province has two cities with Eagle Standards. For every three cities with Eagle Standards you conquer, you receive the Terror of the Legions card, which is worth 1 VP. The game end condition is increased from 10 to 11 VP.

Name: SOLO Schnupperspiel
Description: A promotional demo version of SOLO with 32 instead of 112 cards produced on a sheet of thick paper, perforated to make it easier to separate the cards. The rules and promotion material for other Amigo games are printed on the same sheet. The cards come only in three colors (yellow, blue and red), in the numbers 1 to 6. There is one draw-two, one skip and one reverse card per color and also two draw-four jokers, two regular jokers and one pass hands card.

Name: Super Computer
Description: A card-drafting and tableau-building game. Players receive a hand of cards, each turn they select one, play it face up in front of themselves, and pass the remaining ones to the player on their left. Cards must be connected in a grid to build a super computer. Black connections are wild, all other connections on the cards must match an identical connection.
