Cards that cannot be connected are placed in a personal discard pile, and generate negative point. Each player's computer is scored at the end of each round. The game lasts 3 rounds.

Name: Howrse: The Race of Prestige
Description:
Howrse incorporates various aspects of the mobile/online game into a competitive board game. Each player receives a play mat on which to build and staff an equestrian facility. The players breed and train horses, compete in events, and acquire power-ups from the black market.
—user summary

Fun to share with family and friends

For 5 years now, millions of internet users across the globe have shared the howrse experience with us. For this reason, Owlient has created for you a board game based on the online game. For the first time you can now play horwse, the board game, with family and friends. Competition between equestrian centers is tough. Be the most efficient, know how to make the right decisions, hold back your opponents and watch out for risks! The prestige of your Equestrian Centre depends on it!
—description from the box

Name: NEUBURG: Ottheinrich – Ruhm und Intrige
Description:
As friends and advisors of the Prince Ottheinrich, you want to satisfy his interests by offering him exotic journeys, organizing great feasts, and erecting impressive buildings. In just five rounds in NEUBURG: Ottheinrich – Ruhm und Intrige, give all you've got. Only one of you will win the game as the best advisor. How your fame points come about in the end — whether through strategy, perfidious intrigue, or some luck — doesn't matter. Win by any means necessary. Enjoy the fruits of your success!

—description from the publisher

Name: Repro College Football
Description: The game comes with a single action deck to produce play results, Charts for Passing, Running, and Kicking and special teams play. It includes a sturdy playing field to track the action on the field, dice, markers and all playing parts necessary for the game, including scoresheets to keep stats if you are so inclined. The game produces realistic College football results and each team comes with a power rating for strength of schedule adjustments. Each skill player on offense is given running, passing, and receiving ratings to make their team perform as they did in real life. The defense is given rating adjustments to the offense ratings and the truly great defenses will be reflected in this game. Also, you may call defenses to further adjust the player ratings. Maybe your coaching will be better than the real-life coach!

Name: Repro Baseball
Description: The game comes with all 24 the MLB teams with a minimum of 30 player cards per team. The cards come with a lefty-righty  control factor for both pitchers and batters. The pitcher also comes with a "men on base" column in addition to the regular columns on Repro Baseball ATG teams. All the game parts that are in the Repro ATG baseball game are here with revised Out Decks and Range play decks. The charts have also been revised.

Name: Repro Football
Description: The players are individually rated to recreate their performances. The QB's are rated for short,medium and long pass completions as well as running ability and proclivity to throw interceptions. Rb's are rated for inside and outside ability, pass complete gains, and individual long gains.Rec's are rated for their pass gain ability and the ability to run the end around if they did in real life. If a key lineman or player is injured it will cost your team. The offensive line is rated for on each type of play as a unit. The defense is rated on each type play ans for sacks and interceptions. Special teams play a key part in each teams success just as in real life. Each team has an individual player locator chart that chooses the key player on each play if you do not want to do that yourself.

Name: Evolution: Promo Pack IV
Description:
This expansion add 35 traits cards to the base game Evolution :

    7 cards "Sharp Teeth".
    7 cards "Unstable DNA".
    7 cards "Rapid Mutation".
    7 cards "Quills".
    7 cards "Pest".


Cette extension ajoute 35 cartes Traits au jeu de base Evolution:

    7 cartes "Dents Accérées".
    7 Cartes "Instabilité Génétique".
    7 cartes "Mutation Spontannée".
    7 cartes "Piquants".
    7 cartes "Peste".

Name: La course des loutres
Description:
Embody a family of three otters that must be protected by crossing the river as quickly as possible to reach their lair.

At his turn, each player rolls both dice at the same time.
Of these 2 dice, the player chooses one, and only one, and moves one of his otter pawns to the next identical available animal
to the one inscribed on the die. The second die will not be played.
The player has the choice to advance any of his 3 otters, following the one that suits him the most according to the dice.
During his journey, he moves his otter towards the next animal available, ignoring the boxes of the same animal already
occupied by its otters or those of the opponents.

Once the move is made, it is the next player's turn.

     In case of double, namely 2 identical animals, the player advance one of his otters to the animal in question and play again immediately (this effect is cumulative).
     To get his 3 otters into the lair, the player can use the animal of his choice when the tile is on the face with 6 circles animals.


The game ends as soon as one of the players has his 3 otters in the lair.

—description from the designer

Name: Double trouble
Description:
Double trouble is a rapid fire, rhyming word game that will have you on the edge of you on the edge of your seat.
In double trouble, two teams have 90 seconds to identify double troubles provided by a player sitting in the "hot seat".  The hot seat players team shout out as many answers as they can in an effort to identify the correct ones the opposing team write down their answers hoping to pick up bonus points.
Double troubles are amusing pairs of rhyming words which have to be deduced from cryptic clues and other quick thinking clues by the player in the hot seat.

—description from the back of the box

Name: Escape!
Description:
Panic in the prison. One of the prisoners has the keys with access to all departments. They are trying to escape. Will they manage to, or are they be caught in time?

Escape! is a card game where players subsequently play a card. Action cards will help to let your prisoners escape. The player who gets rid of his cards first is the winner of the round. The remaining players count the value of the cards they still have in their hand. The game is played over multiple round until someone reaches 750 points. The player with the lowest score wins.

Name: Disney Rocket Game
Description:
Disney Rocket game is a 1960's Japanese variation of Pachisi. The game board features 4 Walt Disney characters which players start by placing their tokens on. Players then move around the board by the roll of a dice in a clockwise direction and up a straight to reach their goal line.

Variations to the traditional Parchisi are an added shortcut using a colored rocket and advantages of landing on a particular colored square.

The game box shows Disney characters on a TWA rocket. Erik Voskull, in his book 'Before Mario',(2014) explains that Nintendo obtained a licence in 1959 to produce games featuring Walt Disney characters and themes.

Also in the first half of the 1960s Nintendo introduced a cursive style logo as seen on the back of the playing board. This logo was used on Nintendo's earliest boardgames.

—user summary

Name: This IS Rocket Science
Description:
In This IS Rocket Science, players look to become the most prolific space explorer by landing on or orbiting planets. All game cards serve a dual purpose, acting as both the planets for scoring and the rocket fuel used to reach the planets.

On a turn players will draft cards from a central tableau or combine cards from their hands to reach exact target rocket fuel numbers to either land on or orbit a planet in the tableau. To score a planet, a player will discard cards from their hand and multiple the rocket fuel values together to hit the aforementioned target number. Some cards can also be discarded in order to add or subtract from the fuel value.

Name: Slasher: The Card Game
Description:
Slasher is a quick and simple card game, but it will challenge your observation and bluff skills! You can play for 20-40 minutes with 2 to 5 players.
Use your Villain cards to Slash Actors and score points! Be discreet and observe other players, because every Villain has its own pattern.
You play as both sides: on a first phase, you play your Actors and Action cards to prepare for the perfect setup, then, on the second phase, your use your Villain to catch as many Actors as you can and score points!

—description from the designer

Name: Mit dem Roller durch die Wachau
Description:
The players start on space 1 (Krems). Movement is determined by a die. On some spaces events hinder or benefit the players. The first player to reach space 80 (back in Krems) wins the game.

—user summary

Name: Vom Rhein zum Schwarzwald
Description:
This game contains two separate game boards: "Rhein-Reise" and "Schwarzwald-Reise".

The players start on space 1. Movement is determined by a die. On some spaces events hinder or benefit the players. The first player to reach space 89 or 100 wins the game.

—user summary

Name: Tira
Description:
The players take turns putting one disk on the game board. When all disks are on the board, move their disks one space a turn. 
The goal of the game is to build a sequence of 4 connecting disks in any direction or a 2x2 cluster.

—user summary

Name: Strategist Strategy
Description:
"Who would have thought that we would have to face each other in battle like this..."

Two strategists, who had once been fellow disciples and studied under the same master, find themselves devoted to carry out the most refined battle of wits, bearing the burden of protecting their home country.

A strategist, however, will never enter the battlefield themselves. 
They send out instructions to the Shogun in action based on the information provided by the messengers rushing back and forth from the battlefield.
Figure out the other player’s intention with the help of the time lag in-between to aim for victory.

The game begins with 3 kinds of game pieces, Infantry, Archer and Cavalry taking position. 
How do you establish an advantageous battle formation as you go into battle?

The key to victory is to understand how to properly utilize the special command, the Chain Message, which allows game pieces of the same kind, positioned next to each other in a vertical or horizontal direction, to advance in the same way and in the same turn.
Be conscious of coordinating your military forces and never dividing your formation.

WHAT KIND OF GAME IS IT?

Strategist Strategy is a strategy game for 2 players. The goal is to take down the Shogun of the other player by moving your own pieces, similar to Chess or Shogi.
However, it has the following distinctive features.


     You are free to place the soldier pieces anywhere you want at the beginning of the game. The players take turns, placing 1 piece per turn. The placement of the pieces shall be determined with ever-evolving strategies while watching the moves and battle formation of the other player.  
     There are only 3 different kinds of soldier pieces.
     You are not able to move the pieces immediately during your turn. You may only move them according to the commands issued by “cards” in the previous turn. It is not guaranteed that the game pieces will move as expected. 
     When pieces of the same kind are aligned next to each other, either in a vertical and horizontal direction, you may move them together in the same turn, up to more than 2 pieces at once. 


For example, 3 Infantry pieces in a row may move forward at the same time or multiple Archer pieces may shoot arrows at the same time. In order to win, it is key to establish a good set-up/formation for yourself and break up the set-up/formation of the other player. 

     After the initial placement,  the players decide in secret which game piece will become the Shogun piece, which is the defining piece for winning or losing the game. 


It is crucial to predict the Shogun of your opponent during the game play. 
 In order to get a taste of being a real military strategist, we created this game for 2 players and added game elements that will hopefully remove unrealistic game elements that we had experienced in other strategy simulation games.

—description from the designer

Name: Siege Storm: Styxia Faction
Description:
The legion of destruction from the dark realm of Styxia is a perfect place for anyone who enjoys the salty taste of enemy tears. This faction employs many abilities that force the opponent to discard or wreak havoc on his battle lines. And since Styxian minions are expandable, you get many, many opportunities to sacrifice them for greater evil.

—description from the publisher

Name: Ambitions of Space
Description:
Ambitions of Space is a space 4X strategy about military, economic, technical and political confrontation in the vastness of an unknown galaxy.

On the way to the victory of their power, players establish colonies on distant planets, develop infrastructure and science, form battle fleets and, at their own peril and risk, explore the anomalies of outer space.

The goal of the game is to bring the player-controlled nation to prosperity and global superiority over its competitors. There will be one winner, but you can win one of four ways:

     Military victory: capturing the capital of one of the rivals, you will win, since few can resist its military power.
     Political victory: Having received the most Senate seat, the player wins, as he now decides which laws apply in the galaxy.
     Economic victory: by increasing the capital turnover to 30 units per move, the player wins, since there is no longer in the galaxy what he could not buy.
     Scientific victory: legally gaining fifth-level technology, the player wins, as he is now the engine of progress.

Name: Aeronautica Imperialis: Aircraft and Aces Imperial Navy Cards
Description:
This pack contains the following cards:


     18 Imperial Aircraft cards that are ideal references for use in-game for your Thunderbolts, Thunderbolt Furies, Marauder Bombers and Marauder Destroyers. Also includes the 'Blue Devil' and 'Executioner' named aircraft.
     26 Aircraft Upgrade cards (including ejector seats, infrared targeting, armoured cockpits, and flares or chaff launchers)
     36 Aircraft Weapon cards (including hellstrike missiles, skystrike missiles, and wing bombs)
     6 Ground Defences cards (including hydra flak battery, and manticore missile battery)
     8 Imperial Aces cards, including Dagor-Jarni, Gallus Barret and additional special rules.


You will need a copy of the Aeronautica lmperialis: Wings of Vengeance boxed set or the Rynn's World Air War Campaign book to use the contents of this card pack.

—description from the publisher

Name: Aeronautica Imperialis: Aircraft and Aces Ork Air Waaagh! Cards
Description:
This pack contains the following cards:

- 19 Ork Aircraft cards that are ideal references for use in-game for your Dakka Jets, Fighta Bommers, Eavy Bommers and Grot Bommers. Also includes the 'Vulture' and 'Big Burna' reference cards.
 - 26 Aircraft Upgrade cards
 - 34 Aircraft Weapon cards
- 6 Ground Defences cards including Flak Platform and ’Eavy Flak Kannon
 - 8 Ork Aces cards, including the infamous Toofraker and Da Black Barun

You will need a copy of the Aeronautica lmperialis: Wings of Vengeance boxed game or the Rynn's World Air War Campaign book to use the contents of this card pack.

Name: Aeronautica Imperialis: Crew Cards
Description:
In Aeronautica Imperialis, good crew make all the difference.

Elite pilots, navigators and gunners for your squadron in the form of 6 crew cards that can be combined with your favourite aircraft from Aeronautica Imperialis.  Includes cards for both Ork and Imperial squads.

—description from the publisher

Contains the following six crew upgrades:

Imperial Navy Crew Upgrade: Lightning Reactions
Imperial Navy Crew Upgrade: Expert Gunner
Imperial Navy Crew Upgrade: Master Navigator
Ork Air Waaagh! Crew Upgrade: Lightning Reactions
Ork Air Waaagh! Crew Upgrade: Ace Gunna
Ork Air Waaagh! Crew Upgrade: Strategic Bommer

Name: Isle of Skye: Peças Promocionais
Description:
These promos were offered for preordering the Brazilian version of the game. There were later distributed by the publisher at conventions.
It contains promos published earlier – the Brettspiel Adventskalender 2015 Promo Tiles (2015) and the Kennerspiel des Jahres Promo Tile (2016) – along with a new accessory: an alternative first player marker, alluding to the Kennerspiel des Jahres prize, created as a way to honor the game and its awards.

Name: Puerto Rico: Festival en Puerto Rico
Description:
A Festival is on the works in Puerto Rico, and you need to organize many things!

There are 3 tasks and you get bonus (points, money or settlers) if you are the first one doing any of them.

Promo expansion celebrating Karen & Andreas Seyfarth as special guests at the XIV Festival Internacional de Juegos Córdoba 2019.


Puerto Rico prepara un Festival y necesitamos preparativos. Quien consiga completar antes cualquiera de los objetivos será premiado por ello.

Expansión promocional y gratuita celebrando la visita de Karen & Seyfarth como invitados especiales del XIV Festival Internacional de Juegos Córdoba 2019.

Name: Manhattan: Festival en Manhattan
Description:
The first expansion for Manhattan!
More actions in Manhttan... Your little 1-level pieces will be more interesting now! Everytime you place a little building on the board, you will get an action card. You must play it as soon as possible, or somebody will take it from you!

There are two modules:


     Festival en Manhattan (Festival in Manhattan): 2 rules cards + 5 action cards
     Un monstruo en Manhattan (A monster in Manhattan): 1 rule card + 1 monster card (to cut-and-play, and using the starting player token) - This expansion was included in the Mayfair old edition, but only as a variant rule. Now you have components and a real monster to destroy the buildings.


The art is based on the modern edition (Manddo Games), but the cards can be played and are compatible with all the editions of the game.

Promo expansions celebrating Karen & Amdreas Seyfarth as special guests at the XIV Festival Internacional de Juegos Córdoba 2019.

—description from the publisher

Ahora los bloques de 1 planta van a ser más atractivos, porque te darán acceso a nuevas acciones en las manzanas de Manhattan. Gira tu carta, bloquea una acción rival, roba una carta a alguien, suma una planta a tu pieza, puntúa tu barrio... ¡Y dejad de pisar mi edificio!

Además un gigantesco monstruo arrasa la ciudad. Los rascacielos tiemblan, pero lo cierto es que a la vez que construyes, tienes el control sobre el movimiento de la criatura. Lo malo es que no eres la única persona con poder sobre ella...

Hay dos módulos:

     Festival en Manhattan: 2 cartas de reglas + 5 cartas de acción
     Un monstruo en Manhattan: 1 carta de reglas + 1 cata recortable (se monta sobre la pieza de jugador inicial) - Esta expansión se incluía solo como variante de reglas en la edición de Mayfair del juego. Ahora se presenta con un monstruo de verdad para destruir los edificios.


Incluye dos variantes de reglas: Monstruo Kong y Monstruo Zilla.

Expansión promocional y gratuita celebrando la visita de Karen & Seyfarth como invitados especiales del XIV Festival Internacional de Juegos Córdoba 2019.

Name: Please, Papers
Description:
Based on the video game Papers Please, players take on the role of government workers for the M.O.A. in the totalitarian state of Arstotzka. They will draft cards allowing immigrants, tourists, and citizens to pass through the border, always careful to keep a watchful eye out for members of the EZIC who are trying to bribe others and sow the seeds of dissent. However, players may also wish to align themselves with the EZIC to subvert the brutal government of Arstotzka!

—description from the designer

Name: Corridors et Screams
Description:
In this expansion of Possession, you build a castle as you explore more and more rooms! Place the locations following the gauntlets’ directions and create a map filled with dangers and many new rewards! Just beware the ghosts and the garrison!

—description from the box

Name: Road to Riches
Description:
Road To Riches is an updated and enhanced version of the award-winning Bulls & Bears board game. It has been developed in collaboration between Mario Fischel, Ph.D., a former senior economist at the World Bank, and Krishan Puvvada, Project Lead, Education at Financial Times. Road To Riches has been successfully tested with students in the UK.

Road To Riches is not only a fun and challenging game – it’s a full-fledged ‘Managing Money 101’ course!  Our program also includes quick and easy-to-digest instructional videos, a guidebook on personal finance, and lesson plans for classroom use.  Together, they form a crash course in personal finance that turns newcomers into masters, helping them win the game and at life!

Players start out with $100,000 cash, roll the dice, and proceed around the board. Spaces on the board correspond to different life events such as getting paid a salary, going on vacation, or picking from the three decks of cards that sit at the center of the board. The three decks of cards are: news flashes, knowledge cards, and wild cards. Newsflashes provide a news story, and players must buy and sell investments accordingly in order to win or lose money. Users may accept advice from other players for a shared win or loss in the investment. Knowledge cards are multiple choice cards that teach users key finance information that will be used in the game and life. Wild cards are life events that will cause the loser to win or lose money depending on whether or not they own the right assets. To win, a user must double their money.

—description from the publisher

Name: Marvel Champions: The Card Game – Ms. Marvel Hero Pack
Description:
Already struggling with who she was, and who she wanted to be, teenager Kamala Khan just wanted a simple life. But when Kamala was trapped in a Terrigen Mist enveloping New Jersey, her life got a lot more complex! After emerging from the mist, Kamala discovered she was able to morph her body into nearly anything! Inspired by her idol Carol Danvers, Kamala took on the name Ms. Marvel and New Jersey gained its very own teenage crime fighter!

Fantasy Flight Games is proud to announce the Ms. Marvel Hero Pack for Marvel Champions: The Card Game!

Ms. Marvel is one of the most flexible heroes in the game, able to fit into whatever role is needed while learning to be a hero and protecting her friends from harm!

—description from the publisher
Families: Collectible: Living Card Game (Fantasy Flight Games)
Game: Marvel Champions – The Card Game

Name: Fallout: Wasteland Warfare – Raiders Core Box
Description:
Ruthless and aggressive, gangs of Raiders can be found across the Wasteland scavenging and stealing to survive.

Lead by the strongest and most cunning among them, Veteran Raiders have often managed to piece together rusting suits of scrap Power Armour

Raiders bring a mix of cheap and somewhat disposable troops armed with basic scrap ranged weapons and blades.

Chem crazed Psychos race to close with the enemy and tear them apart in melee, or else send their foes reeling with grenades.

Meanwhile, the savvy Scavvers hang back and pick off chosen targets with accurate rifle fire.

This boxed set contains seven 32mm scale multi-part high-quality resin Raider miniatures, each with unique scenic bases, to allow players to expand their Fallout: Wasteland Warfare games.

Contents

1 x Veteran Raider in Raider Power Armour

3 x Raider

2 x Psycho

1 x Scavver

NOTE: This set does not contain cards, please purchase the Raiders Wave Expansion card pack, which includes all the cards for Wave 2 releases including all three Raiders sets, Assaultrons & Protectrons, Wasteland Vermin (Molerats & Rad Roaches), Deathclaw, Sentry Bot, X0-1 & Armoured Dogmeat and Ghouls.
